alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Moore; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MOORE...NORTH CENTRAL SCOTLAND...SOUTHWESTERN HARNETT...NORTHWESTERN CUMBERLAND AND NORTHERN HOKE COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Aberdeen, or 8 miles southwest of Southern Pines, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Southern Pines, Fort Liberty, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Pope AFB, Spring Lake, Pinebluff, Vass, and Camp Mackall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
